content.description: Climb up over big holds to a bulge and thin edge and up to move left to easier climbing and the coal ledge. Find tricky pro near the flaring crack / horn that protrudes from the roof and do wild moves to gain the stance and bolt on Julia Raye's Journey. From here, continue straight up to the tooth, to more bolts, and dynamic climbing to the anchor.
content.protection: 4 bolts, 2 small wires for under the roof, use the FP of a sling to girth-hitch thru natural pro after turning the rooof.
content.location: After dropping down from the Far Left, this is the 1st route you come to. On the left side of the overhanging base, good holds lead right and up to a flake with bolt. Move back left past bolt using flake to arete and up to walk right on the coal-like ledge. Beneath the flaring crack, get in two small, but sinker wires, surmount the wild roof over jugs, traverse left to FP and then up to bolt under tooth. A slightly overhanging bit with bolts past side pulls and hidden incut edges leads up and left onto ramp to steep blocks and anchor.

content.description:
Climb a right-facing flare / flake system up to the crumbly, coal-like ledge and then turn the roof (crux) to join the bolts on

Julia Rayes Journey

. From here, traverse right to anchor.
content.protection: TR, needs more cleaning and bolts.
content.location:
This is around the corner from

Alpin Lily's Masterpiece

. Right off the trail, look for the small, right-facing dihedral.

content.description:
This relatively fun lead goes up an orange-ish corner with little roofs above, & dynamic moves out right on face, starts below the last bolt of

Julia Rayes Journey

. From that ledge and bolt, continue up the dihedral on big holds. As it steepens find more edges, more steep moves, then right past a flake and thin cracks with small holds & moves to anchor.
content.location: When the trail reaches the crumbly coal-like ledge, above lies the route in an orange dihedral.

content.description: This aesthetic arête first climbs thin pinches directly on the arête for 10 feet or so then moves to the left. Good pockets, edges, and the sharp arête on the right make for a very aesthetic route.
content.location:
This is the left side of

Julias Arête

.

content.description: This aesthetic arête has two options to choose from. The original route climbs the right side of the arête. Start at the base of the arête for full value. Alternately, begin in corner and get pro in a pocket then left to arête and up.
content.protection: Bring a Tri-cam for the pocket if you start from the corner, 4 bolts if you start from the base of the arête proper. This adds a few nice moves to the route.
content.location: This ascends the right side of the sharp arête.

content.description:
Overhanging base, reach for jugs and more holds and other edges and then slopers to gain left-facing corner and on to the coal-like ledge. Turn the roof (crux) past 3 bolts over juggy fins to join

Julia Raye's Journey

. Rock quality dictated bolt location on the roof, so have an attentive belayer, hence the PG rating as a fall at the roof w/ too much slack, might send the climber into the coal ledge. From the stance above the roof, traverse left and then up on great holds on blunt arête. More dynamic moves up to top lead just above big roof to ledge and anchor.
content.protection: Eleven bolts, #3.5 cam, small wired stopper. Hooks are useful on the roof if not leading .10c-.10d. Long-ish slings for traverse past 5th/6th bolts.

content.description:
A thin crack leading right to a rippled face, up little edges, pockets, and roof corner left of black streak leading to the top of

Julias Arête

.
content.location: This is the corner and face left of the arête.

content.description:
Climb up a clean face with a rib to the right then big flat holds; there are small crimps and fins left over roofs to the anchors

Petra's Preference

.
content.location: A seam and clean face with a great rib characterize the easier start right of this route.

content.description:
From Genevieve the Jewel, descend to the right of the corner, after dropping down to the base right of a short dihedral, climb devious 5.5 moves up and right, then go left to a slab & bolt below coal ledge. From the ledge, ascend nice holds over a roof, get the hueco, then climb easier terrain and use the anchors of

Valgedur's Tooth

.
content.location: Move far left once on coal edge.

content.description:
This follows a scooped out dihedral to the coal-like ledge and then turns the roof crack (crux) to join

Julia Rayes Journey

. From here, set up a belay for 2nd pitch traverse right to anchor.
content.protection: You can get good pro in the dihedral and pins for the roof crack.
content.location: This is the 3rd route you come to.
